1. Eco-friendly accommodations: Look for hotels or other accommodations with eco-friendly certifications like Green Key or Travelife. You might also consider booking an eco-friendly retreat or a villa that uses locally sourced, organic food.

2. Eco-tourism: Consider booking eco-friendly tours and activities like birdwatching in the Valley of the Butterflies, or a guided hike in the forests of Rhodes, or a visit to the local farmers' market to support local agriculture.

3. Sustainable Dining: Look for restaurants that use locally sourced, organic ingredients, or support establishments offering vegetarian and vegan cuisine.

4. Bike and Hike: Rent a bike or take a walk rather than using a car to explore the island. This is a great way to enjoy the natural beauty of Rhodes while reducing your carbon footprint.

5. Beach cleanups: Participate in or organize beach cleanups to help reduce litter and pollutant on the island.

By engaging in these environmentally-friendly activities and choosing eco-friendly accommodations, you can have an enjoyable trip to Rhodes while supporting local businesses that prioritise the preservation of the environment.
